definition: (phonetic character used in transliteration of foreign names)/Taiwan pr. [li4]/variant of 璃[li2]

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

sentences.english: A glass or quartz tube has tungsten electrodes sealed in each end .
sentences.chinese: 两根钨丝电极是封在玻璃管或石英管的两端。

sentences.english: Mohr-style pipets are made from glass tubing of uniform bore. Mohr.
sentences.chinese: 型移液管由孔径均匀的玻璃管制成。

sentences.english: This is a glass tube. There are some feedthroughs here to allow electrodes to be potted.
sentences.chinese: 这是个玻璃管，这里有些引线，可以使电极被射击。

sentences.english: It can maintain a fluid interface at a reference line in an inclined glass tube .
sentences.chinese: 它能保持流体分界面在倾斜的玻璃管中基准线上。

sentences.english: Hemostasia was assessed by the methods of glass tube and glass plate.
sentences.chinese: 止血实验采用毛细玻璃管法和载玻片法。

sentences.english: Seal up one end of a glass tube about 34 inches long.
sentences.chinese: 把长约34英寸的玻璃管的一端封闭起来。

sentences.english: Melting away by the inner tube silk arc tube and outer layer of epoxy glass tube.
sentences.chinese: 熔丝管由内层的消弧管和外层环氧玻璃管组成。

sentences.english: This light consists of a glass tube containing argon and a droplet of mercury .
sentences.chinese: 这种灯是由一根充有氩气和微量汞的玻璃管组成。

sentences.english: Stamford workers used to make most of the world's glass tubes.
sentences.chinese: 斯坦福德的工人们过去生产世界上大部分的玻璃管。

definition: Guanzi or Guan Zhong 管仲 (-645 BC), famous politician of Qi 齊國|齐国 of Spring and Autumn period/Guanzi, classical book containing writings of Guan Zhong and his school
